member.name: T:TextObjectModel.RichTextBoxEx
member.summary: Extends to allow the underlying RichEdit control to be loaded from either the shared Microsoft Office DLL or the Windows MSFTEDIT.DLL library.

remarks.para: During its initial creation, the control will attempt to locate a Microsoft Office shared DLL containing the desired RichEdit control. If this fails (either because Office is not installed or the DLL is for a different processor architecture), it will try MSFTEDIT.DLL instead.

In order to utilise the Microsoft Office implementation, the caller must have read access for following registry key: HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\SharedDLLs - this may not be available in sandboxed environments.

Important: The processor architecture of the Microsoft Office installation must match that of the calling process. If both the 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Office are installed, the control will attempt both DLLs until it finds a suitable match.

After loading the libraries into memory, it will then select the highest version of the RichEdit control that is available. It will select from the following window class names (in order of preference):

member.name: M:TextObjectModel.TextExtensions.ToMathML(TextObjectModel.TextRange)
member.summary: Returns a string containing the W3C MathML (MML) markup for the math text in the range.
member.param: The range containing the math text.
member.returns: A string containing the MathML markup.
member.exception: Microsoft Office is not installed, or the XSL stylesheet (used in the conversion process) was not found.

remarks.para: This method works by transforming the OMML representation of the math text to MathML via an XSL stylesheet included with Microsoft Office. This method cannot be used if Microsoft Office is not installed.
Note: If the current process is 32-bit and only the 64-bit version of Office is installed, MathML conversion will be unavailable.

member.example: The following example demonstrates how to build-up math text and then convert it to MathML:

member.name: M:TextObjectModel.TextExtensions.ToOfficeMathML(TextObjectModel.TextRange,TextObjectModel.OfficeMathMLMode,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a string containing the Office MathML (OMML) markup for the math text in the range.
member.param: The range containing the math text.
Determines how the markup is structured.
Whether to include document-level math properties.
member.returns: A string containing one or more top-level OMML tags, depending on the math content and the value of and .
member.exception: The TOM implementation used by does not support math.

remarks.para: This method works by converting the Math RTF in the range to OMML, as the two representations are semantically identical.
Note: Setting the parameter to true will result in an XML fragment (instead of a document). This will also occur if is set to or and there are multiple math zones in the range.
remarks.seealso: Standard ECMA-376: Office Open XML File Formats

member.name: T:TextObjectModel.TextExtensions
member.summary: Contains extension methods for performing additional operations on Text Object Model (TOM) types.

summary.para: Contains managed wrapper classes for Microsoft's Text Object Model (TOM) interfaces (e.g. ITextDocument, ITextRange, etc).

The top-level object in this implementation is the class. The most common usage scenario is to create an instance from a control. This library also includes the control, which provides access to advanced RichEdit functionality.
For more information, refer to the Text Object Model documentation or visit the TOM Classes for .NET project page. Text Object Model (Windows)TOM Classes for .NET

member.name: T:TextObjectModel.TextDocument
member.summary: Represents a top-level document in the Text Object Model (TOM).

remarks.para: Managed wrapper class for the COM interface ITextDocument, including ITextDocument2 functionality. ITextDocument interfaceITextDocument2 interface
You can obtain an instance in a number of ways:

item.description: From an instance of the Windows Forms control (using the method). This is the preferred method.

From a native RichEdit control (by passing its window handle to the method). Use this method if you need to use a specific or custom version of the RichEdit control that you have instantiated yourself.
From a Runtime Callable Wrapper (RCW) for a COM object that implements the ITextDocument interface (see method).
From an unmanaged pointer to the IUnknown interface of a COM object that implements ITextDocument (see method).

member.name: T:TextObjectModel.TextRange
member.summary: Represents a range of text in a document in the Text Object Model (TOM).

remarks.para: Managed wrapper class for the COM interface ITextRange, including ITextRange2 functionality. ITextRange interfaceITextRange2 interface

Ranges are the primary mechanism for reading and manipulating text in TOM. A range provides access to the content and formatting options for the rich text bounded by a particular start and end position.
A range can be obtained by:

item.description: Using the TextDocument.EntireRange property, to get a range that spans the entire document
Requesting a range with a particular start and end position via the TextDocument.Range(Int32,Int32) method
Creating a duplicate of an existing range (using the method), which can then be moved/resized independently
